basics.name: Tom Fleet
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a highly motivated, logical, detail-oriented and experienced self-taught software engineer with a background in aerospace engineering and materials science. I am highly proficient in Python, Go, AWS, REST APIs and microservices/distributed systems and take pride in producing reliable, clean and robust software and architectures. I also enjoy mentoring other engineers and sharing knowledge/experience in areas where I'm able to do so. In my spare time I do lots of side projects, I have also open sourced a few projects, and am an active open source contributor and maintainer.

work.name: Chetwood Financial Ltd.
work.summary: Promoted to technical lead of the decisioning team; setting a technical & strategic direction, designing higher level architectures, acting as a the organisation's decisioning SME, and leading a team of several developers and QAs.
highlights: Led the migration to a brand new implementation of the core decisioning journey, utilising AWS Step Functions to form a state machine based approach.
Introduced and championed the use of static typing in python code as well as significantly stricter linting, leading to a measurable reduction in production errors across a number of services.
Created and rolled out a 'best practice baked in' template for a serverless application that was widely adopted and liked across the organisation.

Regularly presented to business leadership on technical progress of key initiatives, explaining blockers and revised deadlines, working with them to set stakeholder expectations during quarterly planning and ensuring the team are delivering value in the most impactful areas.
Designed and built a performant and highly available scoring service running a number of ML scorecards in parallel using AWS Step Functions, Sagemaker, API Gateway, and Lambda.

Ran a serverless workshop for developers new to the stack, upskilling them in AWS CloudFormation, SAM, Lambdas, API Gateway, DynamoDB etc. We were able to get a simple CRUD API deployed on CodePipeline in a day.

Championed the use of TDD and ran demos/workshops on how to approach problems in a 'test first' way, pairing with other engineers showing how TDD can aid debugging, improve API design as well as significantly increase reliability and robustness in a codebase.
Participated in the interviewing and recruitment of new engineers up to staff level, mentoring new team members and fostering an attitude of engineering excellence and best practice within the team.

work.name: Chetwood Financial Ltd.
work.summary: Python engineer working in a cross-functional pod focused on the development and maintenance of the custom built, in-house lending decision engine.
highlights: Key member of a high performing team responsible for a piece of critical infrastructure
Coordinated and led the release of a novel dynamic pricing mechanism with a turn around time of just 9 days
Managed regular releases of critical infrastructure including 3rd party integration layers and the in-house lending decision engine
Advanced AWS knowledge and experience significantly, particularly Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB and Step Functions

work.name: Junkshon
work.summary: Backend Python/Django developer split between backend development/maintenance and the implementation of machine learning feature sets on a proprietary web-based platform designed to facilitate cloud migrations.
highlights: Development and deployment of text classification microservices via Azure Functions and Openfaas. Also created a robust and reusable “cookiecutter” template for such services.
Maintaining a large enterprise Django REST API, addressing bugs, implementing new API endpoints to expose to a react frontend, refactoring as necessary.
Took on a more dev ops focused role involving deployment of key infrastructure and applications on Azure.
Successfully completed AWS Cloud Practitioner and Azure Developer Associate training.

work.name: Alvant Ltd
work.summary: Key member of a small technical team working in the advanced materials/manufacturing sector.
highlights: Coordinated and led a number of research projects in advanced metal matrix composite technology, characterisation and manufacturing techniques.
Published 2 research papers combining advanced computational techniques and materials science.

work.name: GE Aviation Systems
work.description: Global aerospace engine and structures manufacturer
work.summary: Member of the Materials & Processes team working on the Airbus A350 Composite Trailing Edge.
highlights: Mixture of production support and R&D activities in polymer composite materials to support production of the Airbus A350-900 and -1000

publications.name: Modelling of the Overcasting Reinforcement Process using the LS-DYNA ® ICFD Solver
publications.summary: Innovative use of CFD models combined with liquid metal crystallisation and genetic algorithms in order to predict liquid-solid aluminium bonding to a composite insert.

publications.name: A Machine Learning Approach to Model Interdependencies between Dynamic Response and Crack Propagation
publications.summary: Application of machine learning techniques to thermo-mechanical fatigue damage prediction in aerospace materials.
